definition: to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: The mother of the 4-year-old boy said she is considering transferring her son to another school.
sentences.chinese: 4歲男孩的母親說，她正在考慮給兒子轉校。

sentences.english: Was it hard to adjust to this school as a transfer student?
sentences.chinese: 作爲轉校生，要適應這所學校困難嗎？

sentences.english: Her reading has improved greatly since she changed schools.
sentences.chinese: 自從她轉校以來，她的閱讀水平提高了很多。

sentences.english: when i was in middle school, you transfered my shcool because you were afraid that i counld't take good care of myself.when
sentences.chinese: 在初中，怕我不會照顧自己，讓我轉校。

sentences.english: Most schools will accept your credits through transfer.
sentences.chinese: 在轉校的時候大學校會你的原有學分。

definition: (Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
to serve as a model for others (idiom)/to be a worthy teacher
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
